item.title: Software Circuit Breakers
item.description: I don’t think this is a controversial opinion, but it’s the one I find myself repeating the most often, so I’m putting it here for reference. One the most common anti-patterns in software development is something that looks like this: val tribble = getTribble(id) if (tribble == null) return In some contexts this type of code is fine, but in most it is not. It is a silent failure, which is the worst type of failure!
